Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2013 07:30PM julia07 wrote: One the thing that also concerns us is the immediacy of setting up the CT scan and biopsy.  She had the MRI this morning and she went back to her office and with in 15 minutes of sitting down she got a call from her oncologist's office to set up the further tests.   on a positive side, it was said to me from a person at her oncologists office that spoke with the radiologist that did MRI said: "It's probably nothing but because of her history we wanna go ahead and do the CT scan and biopsy." SO yeah. . . we hang on every word that is said to us. . . we google. . . we freak out. . .we form theories as to why the doctors said and did whatever. . . all the old habits from 6 years ago.  ugh.
Posts.Title: 6 year survivor, found enlarged lymph nodes in opp side MRI julia07 flannelette

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2013 07:16PM - edited Jan 18, 2013 07:19PM by julia07 @ "Flannelette" - thanks so much for the reply and sharing.  Good vibes your way!  My partner had a flu shot on the same arm last Friday.  I had a shot at the same time.  Her arm got red and little swollen the next day or two.  The red area was about the size of a palm.  The oncologist that reviewed her MRI report today thought that the vaccination shouldn't cause this enlargement.  However, all through my partner's 1st cancer treatment they continually found granuloma is certain areas of her body.  She reacted weirdly "atypically" to a lot of different medications, and had a "fever of unknown origin" for weeks where she was hospitalized.  They thought she might have sarcoidosis back then, but found nothing and it was never conclusive.  Some Dr.s she saw thought it may have been from a long past event or it just wasn't sarcoid. so, other than her flu vaccine, she recently had a cold around the same time but recovered quickly w/ Zicam. . . and our 7yo right now is getting over the flu.  (day 5) Maybe she has something going on with her immune system that isn't presenting any other symptoms, but. . . sigh, who knows?  All of the past memories are coming back and psychologically. . . it's tough thanks again for sharing.  I really appreciate it.
Posts.Title: 6 year survivor, found enlarged lymph nodes in opp side MRI julia07 flannelette

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2013 07:18PM - edited Jan 18, 2013 07:20PM by julia07 @ mammalou: Great news!   I sooooo wanna be able to type that next week. :)
Posts.Title: 6 year survivor, found enlarged lymph nodes in opp side MRI julia07 flannelette
6 year survivor, found enlarged lymph nodes in opp side MRI julia07 flannelette

Posts.Content: julia07 wrote: Hi all I'm new here.  My partner had her routine MRI today and they found enlarged lymph nodes on the other side from where she had breast cancer 6 years ago.  Back then she had Stage 2A, node negative, ER positive invasive breast cancer.  She had a mastectomy, didn't require radiation, but chemotherapy.  The chemo didn't go well.  She contracted a serious pneumonia at the time and they stopped her chemo treatment.  (that experience was the hardest of my life.) She's scheduled for an ultrasound and biopsy on Monday with a follow up from her oncologist on Wednesday.  Waiting. waiting wait.  We've been here before and it feels like PTSD.  We had some recent good years and I don't wanna be back here.  I really don't.  The fears, anxiety, trying to focus on work. . . staying strong for my spouse. . . keeping our 7yo calm and happy.  Ugh + sigh + I wanna cry.  I just wanna cry and I can't.  I can't upset my kiddo.  I wanna take care of my sweetie. I wanna make her feel better.   anyway we're waiting and I would love to hear about scares about enlarged lymph nodes that turned out to be nothing.   thanks.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 6 year survivor, found enlarged lymph nodes in opp side MRI julia07 flannelette
